column5: As I posted on my status, I went onto Nipissing this evening, drove through mountains of slush in the pouring rain and used 40$ of gas to get to Goose Islands..  We set up some lines and waited... first fish was a Smalleye and went back... so were the second and third ...hmmm  Then a Perch and another...hmmm  Then a little Ling.  finally a good hit..17.5" Walleye..  and then another few Smalleyes...  needless to say I came home empty handed and soaking wet but had fun nonetheless. Total count...8 Walleye , 2 Perch and a Ling in about 2.5 hours  Besides, I needed an escape from my wife ,for when she got home to find a 2037.66$ HYDRO BILL/62 days of usage.  on the kitchen table .  :wallbash:      Randy
8 walleye in a couple hours is good. Why the Goose Islands? I thought you were heading to Blueberry Island in the mouth of the French?
Nice to see you pick up a couple Randy.

We went out to my buds shack ... where we could have shelter from the rain , we took the chance of missing out on lunkers vs maybe catching a few legal limits... Nipissing won this time 'round but I'll head out on Saturday when I have more than a few hours and try a few spots around the mouth by Brown Island and Franks Point.
We'll have to try that area together this spring with my boat. I'd like to mark a few drop-offs and shoals with my HDS and then visit them in the winter.
You runnin a grow op?  That is one crazy bill.
Right on Randy Got to love when the fishes come out to play Sounds like fun Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice going bud.  What's up with your bill?!  Ch'pensais que tu chauffais au bois!!

Last year's big winter bill ( I heat with Hydro) was 750.00$ this winter was much warmer than last winter so I assumed I used less energy... but my bill just about tripled?  I have no idea why.. come Monday they're sending a technician to inspect my house for faulty grounds that may be the reason for the hike?
